comments.body: I don't know why the "Info" interface is needed instead of just passing in the Lister.  It seems like it's just a direct passthrough to the Lister...  But it's what was done for PV, PVC.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +45,49 @@	PVInfo                         predicates.PersistentVolumeInfo
	PVCInfo                        predicates.PersistentVolumeClaimInfo
	StorageClassInfo               predicates.StorageClassInfo
	VolumeBinder                   *volumebinder.VolumeBinder
	HardPodAffinitySymmetricWeight int32

comments.body: Random question: Do we have a standard about whether you re-state the function name in the comment? Personally I don't like this style (I'd prefer "Registers a fit predicate..." as it was before) but I guess we don't have a standard practice.
Its a godoc convention. From the blog, a godoc "comment is a complete sentence that begins with the name of the element it describes." govet issues a warning if you don't do this I believe.
It's godoc style to repeat the function name verbatim, for whatever reason. :/
